etymology.description: semantic 車 (“chariot”) + phonetic (original form of 螾; not 勹). Shuowen: ideogrammic 車 + 勹 (“to surround”).
etymology.interpretation: Built on 車 to evoke warfare/vehicles, paired with a phonetic element whose lineage (cf. 螾, 旬, 勻, 云) points to an early -un/-win sound that developed into jūn. Later graphic evolution made it look like 勹 was the phonetic, which also inspired the Shuowen’s ideogrammic reading of ‘cart + wrapping/surrounding’.
etymology.simplification: Simplified to 军 by adopting a long-used clerical/cursive variant that streamlines and compresses the 車 component; this shorthand was standardized in the PRC simplification.

examples.chinese: 军队在黎明出发(軍隊在黎明出發)。
examples.english: The army set out at dawn.

examples.chinese: 他参军以后成为一名军官(他參軍以後成為一名軍官)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cānjūn yǐhòu chéngwéi yī míng jūnguān.
examples.english: After enlisting, he became an officer.

examples.chinese: 军民团结一心(軍民團結一心)，共同抗灾(共同抗災)。
examples.pinyin: Jūn-mín tuánjié yī xīn, gòngtóng kàngzāi.
examples.english: The army and the people unite as one to fight disasters together.
